title: Pasta Alfredo
steps: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
3. Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
4. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper.
5. Toss cooked pasta in the sauce until well coated. Serve hot.

title: Grilled Salmon
steps: 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
2. Rub salmon fillets with olive oil and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
3. Place salmon fillets on the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
4. Serve grilled salmon with lemon slices.

title: Caprese Salad
steps: 1. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating them.
2. Sprinkle fresh basil leaves over the slices.
3. Drizzle balsamic glaze on top. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Serve immediately as a refreshing salad.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, etc.)
steps: 1. Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add minced garlic and sliced chicken breasts to the skillet. Cook until chicken is no longer pink.
3. Stir in mixed vegetables and soy sauce. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp.
4. Serve chicken stir-fry over cooked rice.

title: Banana Bread
steps: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine mashed bananas and melted butter.
3. Stir in baking soda and salt. Mix in sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract.
4. Gradually add flour, mixing until just combined.
5. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
6. Bake for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow banana bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Ensalada César con Pollo
steps: 1. Precalienta el horno a 200°C. Coloca las pechugas de pollo en una bandeja para hornear y rocíalas con aceite de oliva. Espolvorea sal y pimienta al gusto. Hornea durante 25-30 minutos o hasta que estén cocidas. Deja enfriar y córtalas en tiras.
2. Lava y corta la lechuga romana en trozos. Colócala en un tazón grande para ensaladas.
3. Agrega los crutones y el queso parmesano rallado sobre la lechuga.
4. Coloca las tiras de pollo horneado sobre la ensalada.
5. Rocía la salsa César sobre la ensalada y mezcla bien.
6. Sirve la ensalada César con pollo en platos individuales y disfruta.
